Happy New Year! Wishing you and your family a happy and healthy 2017!

Regardless of rolling back their plan to gut the Office of Congressional Ethics, House Republicans have already communicated their values for the new Congress. Behind closed doors and before the new session of Congress even began Republicans attempted to eliminate the only independent ethics panel for Members of Congress. Before engaging in further actions that will undermine the American people's expectation that their government will be open and transparent, Republicans should be mindful of the outrage they received from this sneaky and secretive act.
It was a great honor and privilege to be sworn in today for my second term of Congress. I look forward to continuing to serve the people of #CA11!

Thanks to the Affordable Care Act health coverage has become affordable for millions of Americans. In California alone, seniors have saved an average of $1,044 on each Medicare prescription drug.  But instead Republicans’ health care repeal will cause millions of Americans to lose their health coverage, cause premiums to skyrocket, increase health care costs, put insurance companies back in charge of your health care, and damage local hospitals. I am willing to work across the aisle to improve the #ACA so that it can better serve the American people, but Republicans just want to #MakeAmericaSickAgain. Learn more about the risks associated with repealing the ACA here: http://money.cnn.com/2017/01/02/news/economy/repealing-obamacare-health-insurance/index.html    If you or someone you know has been personally helped by the Affordable Care Act please share you story in the comments below. #ACAWorks
Tragic news today out of Fort Lauderdale. Our sincere and deepest condolences are with the victims of the #FLLshooting, their families, and the people of Florida.

Our nation's top intelligence agencies have determined that Russian directed efforts interfered with our 2016 election. Every American, regardless of party affiliation, should be outraged and appalled by these actions. This direct interference with our election system jeopardizes our democracy. Now more than ever, we must put partisanship aside and work together to thwart future #cyberattacks.
First Lady Michelle Obama for the last 8 years you have served our country with dignity. You have made our nation very proud!

Education has been the great equalizer in our country. A quality education has the power to equip students with the skills they need to succeed throughout their lives. Today, approximately 90% of our nation’s students attend public schools, thus it is of serious concern that the President-elect has nominated Betsy DeVos as the next Secretary of Education. Her lack of experience with public schools either as a student, parent of a student, educator, or professional working on education policy leaves her ill-equipped to appreciate the true value public education provides our students. I was proud to join my colleagues Representatives Mark Pocan and Mark Takano in support of #publiceducation and the House Public Education Caucus.
Will Donald #Trump put the presidency first, or his businesses first? #ConflictsClause #EmolumentsClause

As we approach next week’s #inauguraladdress, one of the great civic traditions in our nation’s political life, let us pause and reflect on the many historic speeches. On these occasions we witnessed America’s Presidents rise to the occasion, ignite hope in our citizens, and show reverence to the Office of the Presidency.  For the next week we will be posting quotes and clips from some of our favorite inaugural addresses, let's begin with President George Washington.

It is with a heavy heart and deep personal conviction that I have decided not to attend the #Inauguration on January 20, 2017. I believe when the President-elect places his hand on the Bible and takes the sacred oath that Presidents Washington and Lincoln did before him, he will in that very moment, be in violation of that oath and the Constitution.

Shame on #DonaldTrump for kicking off MLK Weekend by criticizing one of our most treasured civil rights leaders. Thank you to my friend Congressman John Lewis for your service, activism, and personal sacrifice for our country. Your record speaks for itself.

#ICYMI: This is one example of the millions of personal stories about how a repeal of the #AffordableCareAct will negatively impact the American people. Today, we celebrate Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s legacy as one of the greatest civil rights leaders of our time. In order to honor his memory and commitment to justice and opportunity, let us all be inspired to work for a more free and more fair America. #MLKDAY2017

Moments like the one pictured below, from President Lincoln's First Inaugural Address, have inspired generations of Americans to band together and fight to protect our Constitution and our national values. #InauguartionWeek

On the eve of tomorrow's Inauguration, I am reminded of President Franklin D. Roosevelt's famous line that inspired a generation to be strong, resilient, and courageous. #InaugurationWeek  “This great Nation will endure as it has endured, will revive and will prosper. So, first of all, let me assert my firm belief that the only thing we have to fear is fear itself—nameless, unreasoning, unjustified terror which paralyzes needed efforts to convert retreat into advance”

Earlier this week I spoke with Neil Cavuto on Fox Business about my decision to not attend tomorrow's #TrumpInauguration. This decision was nonpartisan and is based strictly on the President-elect's devisive behavior, lack of decency displayed to his fellow Americans, and the conflicts of interest he will bring to the Office of the President. Despite this decision, I have been in elected office long enough to know that you get up the next day and you work with the people that have been duly elected—that’s part of your job and that’s what I intend to do.

Working families have been hit hard and the incoming Administration is sure to enact policies to double down on that pain. We need to do everything we can to help Americans earn a fair wage, provide for their families, own homes, and retire with dignity. I joined with my friend Mark Pocan and my Democratic colleagues to host our first regional “Future of Work, Wages, and Labor” event to address the obstacles facing the American workforce. Congressman Pocan and I look forward to taking our initiative on the road to Congressional districts nationwide, because our hardworking families deserve to have their voice heard. #WorkWagesandLabor
For 8 years President Obama has served our country with dignity, poise, and grace. #ThankYouObama for fighting for equality and inspiring hope in America. #YesWeDid

I was honored to join local leaders on a panel at Contra Costa College to discuss how we can work together to protect the civil and human rights of our most vulnerable populations. As a member of the Equality Caucus, I have fought to ensure that all Americans are treated equally regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, nationality, immigration status, or income and will continue to do so during the new Administration.
I met with the East Bay Leadership Council to discuss the importance of protecting the Affordable Care Act, maintaining funding for Medicare, and improving our local transportation infrastructure.

I was proud to join thousands of Contra Costa residents in the true spirit of democracy to march for women's rights, environmental protection, healthcare, and equality for all Americans at the Walnut Creek #WomensMarch. We are stronger together. #WhyWeMarch
I enjoyed meeting Dr. Fred Wood, the new Chancellor of the Contra Costa Community College District. Welcome back to Contra Costa County Dr. Wood and I look forward to working with you.

On #holocaustremembrance day, join me in saying "never again" by committing to speak out whenever there is injustice in the world.

I enjoyed visiting Making Waves with former Congressman George Miller in Richmond. Making Waves is helping to provide West County students with the tools to succeed in college and beyond. During my first term in Congress, I visited every school district in California’s 11th Congressional District to discuss our education system and hear firsthand from teachers, parents, students, and administrators.

During his first week in office, President Trump has already taken divisive positions on immigration, health care, hiring of federal workers, voter fraud, and crowd size at public events. Such actions have widened the rift between Americans on both sides of the political spectrum, rather than unifying as one American body. We cannot afford to be a divided country.   It is my hope that the President takes note of these polarized responses, and recognizes that this is no way to govern our country. No one person in America is the same, we all come from different backgrounds, have varying points of view and values – which is our greatest asset. It is our duty as Americans to embrace these differences and live out our country’s motto: “E pluribus unum:” out of many one. Finding solutions to the most pressing problems facing our nation depends upon finding a common ground.

The uncertain future of the Affordable Care Act has left millions of Californians worried about the future of their health care coverage. I joined former Congressman George Miller and Contra Costa County officials to discuss the importance of ensuring every American has access to quality, affordable health care. We cannot let the historic gains made in health care coverage be eroded by an irresponsible repeal without a viable replacement. #ProtectOurCare

It was a heartbreaking day in American and across the globe when President Trump signed an executive order banning immigrants from predominantly Muslim countries and froze admission of refugees. This action is morally reprehensible and unconstitutional. Since it's founding, America has long been a sanctuary for those seeking safety from violence, oppression, and persecution. Our greatest strength as a nation has and always will stem from our diversity. We will not sit idly as our most fundamental values are attacked, and we must not turn our backs on those seeking refuge. #NoBanNoWall

Tonight House and Senate Democrats gathered with many Americans to protest President Trump's executive orders. Taking reckless actions to erode our core values does not strengthen our national security - it weakens it. #NoBan

#ThankYouSallyYates for reminding us that the Attorney General "has an obligation to follow the law and the constitution." We need more dedicated public servants like Sally Yates. We are thankful for her service and steadfast commitment to the Constitution.
I will be speaking soon to share my concerns about the nomination of Andrew Puzder as Secretary of Labor.

Thank you Natalia for writing in and sharing your concerns about the #BorderWall! I share your same concerns, and will fight in Congress to stop such efforts. Please feel free to share your thoughts and opinions with me just like Natalia did, by writing or calling our office. We want to hear from you!

If you started your application to sign up for health care coverage by midnight last night, but did not have a chance to complete it you have until this Saturday, February 4th to finish it. Don't miss your opportunity to get covered with #CoveredCA!
While we do not condone the violence that erupted last night at U.C. Berkeley, threatening to strip the world’s leading public institution and research facility of essential federal funds is foolish.

#ICYMI I explained how President Donald J. Trump's flurry of executive orders during his first 2 weeks in office is like a game of Whac-A-Mole. Each serves as a distraction to the poor action before it, but these tactics have not gone unnoticed. We will hold him accountable on these and future actions.

Instead of working to cut health care coverage for 20 million Americans, we should expand access to high-quality care and strengthen already existing and effective programs like Medicare. The United States spends more per person on health care than every other developed country. Meanwhile countries with single-payer systems have truly universal plans that cover everyone and spend far less than the U.S. Allowing all Americans to join Medicare is the best way to control future health care costs. #Medicare4All
I am speaking with #CA11 residents about the Affordable Care Act in Bay Point. Health care is a right that every American should enjoy. #ProtectOurCare

The Affordable Care Act protects 129 million Americans with pre-existing conditions from discrimination. If the #ACA were irresponsibly repealed, 5.8 million Californians with pre-existing conditions would be likely to lose coverage. I spoke with #CA11 residents about my work to #ProtectOurCare in Congress because health care is the right of every American.

I strongly support U.S. Congresswoman Stephanie Murphy's bill (H.R. 804) to keep political operatives, like Steve #Bannon, off the National Security Council. Partisan politics has no place at the table.

Betsy DeVos has demonstrated she has a rudimentary understanding of the issues facing our students, teachers, and schools, which should have disqualified her from serving as Secretary of Education. She possesses no experience with the public education system as either a student, parent of a student, educator, or professional working on education policy. Now that Ms. DeVos is confirmed, she is charged with the responsibility of advocating for and protecting ALL students regardless of their background. I hope that she will fully embrace this duty.

It is an honor to receive an appointment to continue serving on the Oversight and Government Reform Committee. The American public deserves a government that is accountable, transparent, and fair. It has become increasingly apparent that under the new administration it is more essential than ever that Congress exercises its authority to conduct oversight of the executive branch.

After @SenWarren  was banned from the Senate floor, she took to Facebook to read the full text of Coretta Scott King’s letter on AG nominee Jeff Sessions’ civil rights record. I hope you will take a few minutes to watch the video.  In America we celebrate those who stand up and speak out. #shepersisted

Repealing the ACA would leave 5.8 million Californians with pre-existing conditions at risk of losing their coverage. The uncertain future of a repeal without a viable replacement has left many people worried about the future of their coverage. Join us as we discuss our work to ensure every American is covered by quality, affordable health care. I hope to see you there!  For more information and to RSVP: http://bit.ly/2kSAcWM
I am continually impressed by the young leaders in #CA11 working to serve our communities. Thank you Aryan for your dedicated service!

There is no place for anti-Semitism in our communities or our country. Since January there have been more than 60 bomb threats at Jewish Community Centers across the country; such threats are cowardly and contrary to our American values. In a country that celebrates diversity and was founded on religious freedom, hateful acts directed at one group of people is hatred toward us all.   Sadly, President Trump’s comments on these anti-Semitic threats to the Jewish community is too little, too late. Throughout his campaign and even as President, his refusal to speak out against hatred and bigotry has fostered an environment which promotes division rather than unity.
We had a remarkable turn out at our town hall in Pleasant Hill. It's wonderful to see so many #CA11 residents engaged! #DeSaulnierTownHall
This morning I joined Phil Matier to discuss the heightened participation & activism at recent town hall meetings. It is wonderful to see so many engaged.
Before President Trump considers adding an additional $54 billion in #defensespending, we need a complete outside audit of the $125 billion in bureaucratic waste found at the Pentagon in December.

Today, my amendment to the SCRUB Act which directs a review how potential repeals of federal regulations will adversely affect public health overwhelmingly passed the House of Representatives with bipartisan support. During my time in the California State Senate, I helped strengthen the first-in-the-nation ‘Health in All Policies’ program, which requires a similar review of government actions and potential negative impacts to public health, such as an increase in air and water pollution which can lead to increased risk of illness. This program has led to greater collaboration across agencies, established more robust protections for public health, and has saved taxpayer dollars.  I will continue to push my Republican colleagues to consider public health before enacting policies that will adversely impact the American people. To learn more about the Health in All Policies program read more here: http://www.cdph.ca.gov/programs/Pages/HealthinAllPolicies.aspx

Cal Knight, President & CEO of John Muir Health, a community based not-for-profit health system in #CA11, is my guest for tonight’s Joint Session. The Affordable Care Act is helping John Muir to improve the health of our communities.

The most important part of President Trump's Joint Address to Congress is not what he said, but rather what he chose not to say. While shifting his tone to sound more Presidential, the content of his speech was more of the same – broken promises. President Trump was light on explicit policy directives on how he plans to address the most pressing issues of our time.  Read my full statement here: http://bit.ly/2m6qen3

Since its implementation the ACA has helped approximately 20 million previously uninsured Americans gain health care coverage. California has witnessed the most dramatic gains in coverage nationwide – uninsured rates have been cut by more than half and residents now have more choice when it comes to their insurance options. I am committed to fighting for efforts to improve upon the work that has already been done and to expand and enhance coverage, and will resist efforts to repeal this landmark legislation!   If you have been personally impacted by the Affordable Care Act, I want to hear from you. Please share your story about how the ACA has benefited you! #ACAWorks

The Washington Post's report that Attorney General Sessions lied under oath about meeting with Russian Ambassador Sergey Kislyak twice last year and is cause for him to immediately resign. The American people deserve to know the full extent to which the Trump campaign and its surrogates colluded with the Russians to interfere in our democratic process. America’s top cop must be honest and above reproach, and Attorney General Sessions’ actions have shown he can be neither.   Read my full statement calling for the resignation of Attorney General Sessions here: http://bit.ly/2mfIhY3

This week I was reminded of one of my favorite quotes by Alexis de Tocqueville in Democracy in America: "America is great because she is good, and if America ever ceases to be good, she will cease to be great." Hear more about my thoughts on this quote and the busy week we had in Washington in the video below.

The U.S. has just five percent of the world's population and almost 25 percent of the world's prisoners. I joined local officials in West County for a panel discussion on mass incarceration and race following the screening of 13th, a moving documentary that explores the intersection of race and justice in America.

Today’s shameful attempt by the Trump Administration to repackage the Muslim and refugee ban is still both morally reprehensible and unconstitutional. The Administration has even admitted that the intention of the new travel ban is the same as before – at its core discriminatory and counterproductive to our national security. Actions like the one taken today are just another attempt by the ‘Deflector in Chief’ to distract from the underlying issues of collusion with the Russian government and the President’s continued attempts to ignore addressing his many conflicts of interest.

After the ridiculous and damaging claims President Trump made this weekend, it is more important than ever that an independent commission and special counsel are appointed and immediately begin working to investigate President Trump’s tax returns, any Russian interference in our election, and Attorney General Sessions’ known meetings with the Russian Ambassador. In addition to this investigation, the appropriate House and Senate committees should hold hearings. It is essential that the American people are fully informed about the extent to which a foreign power attempted to undermine our democracy.

Last night, after seven years, Republicans revealed their long-awaited health care plan, which would cause millions of Californians to lose their coverage, increase premiums and deductibles for working families, force seniors to pay five times higher than what others pay for health coverage, and cause 11 million Americans to lose coverage through the termination of Medicaid expansion. The plan provides massive tax incentives to insurance companies, the pharmaceutical industry, and the wealthy, but has yet to be reviewed by the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office to determine how it will impact taxpayers and the federal deficit. Rushing legislation through committees without a thorough vetting is reckless and rolls back years of progress made under the Affordable Care Act. #NotAPlan #TrumpCare

Today I am wearing red in solidarity with the millions of women and men standing up for gender equality and women's empowerment in United States and across the globe. On #InternationalWomensDay and every day I am fighting for equal pay for equal work, paid family leave, affordable health care, and reproductive rights.  We need a Congress that recognizes women's rights are human rights.

On #DayWithoutAWoman we are raising awareness for #genderequality and #womensempowerment with the women in our office joining the strike. A majority of my staff are women, and my D.C. and California offices are headed by two incredible women. The contributions the women on my staff make help serve the residents of Contra Costa County, and I am thankful for all they do. If every working woman in America were to strike today it would cost the United States about $21B in gross domestic product. Women make up nearly half of our work force and their labor adds $7.6 trillion annually to our GDP. It is long past time that we value women’s work by ensuring equal pay for equal work. http://nymag.com/thecut/2017/03/what-it-would-cost-u-s-economy-if-all-women-went-on-strike.html

This week I joined my colleague, Rep. Raul M. Grijalva, to introduce federal legislation which would fix a decades-old policy that has caused hundreds of immigrants who honorably served in the U.S. Military to be deported. If we respect immigrants enough to allow them to fight for our country, and potentially lay down their lives, it is our responsibility to protect and honor them after their service ends.

Thank you actress, Edie Falco, for sharing your passion and commitment for #animalwelfare. I am proud to support the Battlefield Excellence through Superior Training Practices Act (H.R. 3172), which would phase out the use of live animals in military battlefield trauma training and help ensure more humane treatment of animals.

The Bay Area was rocked by the fatal shootings of Kate Steinle and Antonio Ramos, in which the gun men used weapons that were stolen from federal law enforcement officers.There is a glaring gap in current policies regarding gun safety which has led to federal law enforcement weapons being stolen and subsequently used in crimes.  During an Oversight Dems hearing I had the opportunity to ask the Director of US Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives about the gaps in current practices, areas for improvement, and his support for my Federal Law Enforcement and Public Protection Act, which would help address this issue.

Today I am out front of the Contra Costa Regional Medical Center to discuss the impacts a repeal of the Affordable Care Act could have on many local residents. This week we expect to see an official score from the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office on the Republican effort to repeal the Affordable Care Act. It is clear this score will highlight the devastating impacts millions of working families would face if the bill were to become law. We should work to improve the ACA rather than pushing through a bill that would cause Americans to #PayMoreForLess when it comes to their health coverage.

Facts should influence lawmakers to find the best policy solutions. As the health care debate continues to unfold, I am reminded of a quote by the late Senator Daniel Moynihan: "Everyone is entitled to their own opinions, but not their own facts."  Today's fact that 24 million Americans stand to lose health care coverage by 2026 under the Republican effort to repeal the ACA, highlights a flawed policy agenda. Learn more about the #CBOscore in my By the Numbers: #Trumpcare Dissected.
I visited the Town of Moraga to discuss the progress of the Rheem Sinkhole project. We are working with local, state, and federal entities to expedite the project.

I sat down with U.C. Berkeley students to hear their concerns about some of our more vulnerable student populations. I look forward to continuing to work with these future leaders to ensure our students have the resources they need to succeed.

Congratulations to U.C. Berkeley on receiving a $21 million Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency grant to advance neuroscience research! I stopped by their Brainstorming Future Neurotechnology symposium to discuss the importance of prioritizing medical and scientific research.

After many months of promising to protect America’s working families, President Trump is asking Congress to pass a budget that slashes critical funding for job training programs, education, clean energy, and lifesaving medical search. Our national values are communicated by where we choose to invest our money. The budget put forth by the President suggests that he values building up our military over making investments in programs that strengthen our middle class and setup our children for future success.

As someone who spent 10 years serving on the California Air Resources Board, I know firsthand how important promoting air quality is for our economy and environment. California has led the world in energy independence and green technology. Yesterday's announcement by President Trump to rollback fuel economy standards has the potential to erode decades of progress and threatens to send us back to a time when we were oil dependent on the Middle East. I stand ready to defend again any attempts to erode our fuel economy standards that protect our environment now, and for generations to come.

Several federal courts have now reaffirmed that President Trump’s Muslim and refugee ban is unconstitutional. After a thorough review, the courts determined this executive order issued under the thinly veiled guise of national security is in fact discriminatory. Instead, this ban would leave thousands of refugees stranded in war-torn countries and severs family members from one another. We already have strict vetting procedures in place to ensure those entering our country do not pose a risk to our citizens. To date, there has never been a terrorist attack carried out by any refugee in our country. This morally reprehensible ban does not strengthen our national security, but instead emboldens our terror groups to use this ban as a recruiting tool. This check on the Administration’s gross overreach shows that our Constitution working as the framers intended.

President Donald J. Trump's proposed cuts to National Institutes of Health (NIH) is a death sentence to millions of Americans, as well as decades of groundbreaking and life saving medical research. Cutting the NIH's budget by 20 percent would leave Americans more vulnerable to cancer and other diseases.

There has to be an independent investigation into Russia’s interference in our Presidential election. Today’s revelations should concern elected officials from both political parties. This cannot be a partisan issue.

We are excited to celebrate the first National Rosie the Riveter Day today as Rosies from around the country gathered at the U.S. Capitol and in Richmond at the Rosie the Riveter WWII Home Front National Historical Park. During World War II thousands of women joined the war effort at the Kaiser Shipyards in Richmond where they produced more ships than any other shipyard in the country. These brave and dedicated women broke barriers by taking jobs as riveters, welders, and electricians, paving the way for future generations. I am so proud to have this important piece of history in my district and cannot think of a more fitting tribute to the invaluable contributions these women made than a national day of recognition during Women's History Month.

For too many years, we’ve underfunded our nation’s infrastructure.  A lack of investment has created an $836 billion backlog of unmet needs for highways and bridges and another $89 billion in public transit needs. Today I joined Rep. Peter DeFazio to introduce legislation that would provide $500 billion to rebuild our crumbling network of roads, bridges, and transit systems. By increasing gas and diesel user fees by just a penny per year we can invest in America’s infrastructure and create good-paying, American jobs in the process. Learn more: http://bit.ly/2nSuFAz
The President’s budget proposal to eliminate the Chemical Safety Board is counterproductive to public health, the environment, and workers.

Today marks the seventh anniversary of when the Affordable Care Act was signed into law and the facts show that we’ve made dramatic progress. Thanks to the #ACA, the uninsured rate is at an all-time low and 129 million Americans with pre-existing conditions are protected. In California the positive impacts have been even more significant with the uninsured rate dropping 54 percent as more than 3.8 million Californians gained health coverage. On this day, we should be celebrating the lives saved, coverage gained, and costs reduced by the ACA, rather than considering the Republican health care plan that would roll back the progress made and leave millions uncertain about the future of their health care coverage.  #ACA7

Today’s updated #Trumpcare score by the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office would only half the deficit savings of the original version as it gives a trillion-dollar tax cut the wealthiest in our country. Further this CBO score reaffirms what we already knew – this bill would be devastating for hurt millions of Americans. The Republican health care plan would strip coverage from 24 million Americans, force seniors to pay five times more for their coverage, cut Medicaid funding by $880 billion, and provide $592 billion of tax credits to the wealthy, as opposed to $361 billion in tax credits to help middle class and working class families afford health care. This plan is not health care for everyone, but rather health care for the privileged few. #ProtectOurCare
Answering the phone and hearing concerns from #CA11 residents about today's vote on the Republican #PayMoreForLess health care plan. #TrumpCare
As a former small business owner, Member of Congress, and survivor of cancer I am outraged that #TrumpCare would strip millions of Americans of their health care coverage.
Tune in as I go live to hear my thoughts on today's failure of the Republican health care plan. #TrumpCare

Today President Trump signed a destructive executive order that will dismantle the Clean Power Plan -- a dangerous retreat from our fight against climate change. This short-sighted action disregards the consensus among scientists that carbon pollution directly impacts the Earth’s climate. As a former member of the California Air Resources Board, I have witnessed first-hand the impacts of global warming in our community on both human health and the environment. In California, our Renewable Portfolio Standard has not only improved public health, the environment, and helped grow our economy to the sixth largest in the world, but it has reduced our reliance on foreign oil. It has been clear since the campaign that President Trump valued investments in big oil, and today’s action underscores that he values growing the fossil industry over the health of the American people. We should be investing in cleaner air, water, and renewable energy not ignoring scientific facts. It should be the responsibility of the U.S. government to protect our planet and public health for generations to come. #DefendScience
